meanings.definition: The concluding part of a musical composition.
meanings.sent1: The orchestra played the beautiful coda to end the symphony.
meanings.sent2: After the song ended, the coda was played softly by the pianist.
meanings.sent3: The coda was like the cherry on top of the musical cake.
meanings.sent4: The coda brought the entire piece to a graceful close, like a gentle wave washing ashore.
meanings.sent5: The audience held their breath as the coda filled the concert hall with its final notes.

meanings.definition: The final section of a literary work.
meanings.sent1: In the last chapter, the author wrapped up the story with a satisfying coda.
meanings.sent2: The coda of the novel revealed the fate of the main characters.
meanings.sent3: The coda of the book tied up all loose ends in a neat bow.
meanings.sent4: The coda of the story was like the last piece of a jigsaw puzzle, completing the picture.
meanings.sent5: The coda of the play left the audience with a sense of closure and fulfillment.

meanings.sent1: As a coda to his speech, the speaker thanked everyone for their support.
meanings.sent2: The party ended with a coda of fireworks lighting up the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The coda of the meeting was a round of applause for the hardworking team.
meanings.sent4: Her parting coda was a warm smile that lingered in the room long after she left.
meanings.sent5: The coda of the conversation was a heartfelt goodbye that echoed in their hearts.
